column4: every few seconds there is an anoyying noise in the system - what can it be?
could be fans starting up. or optical drive polling
rsk - ok, i will do that
rsk - it isnt the optical drive but i can open check the fans, it doesnt sound related to fans but i will check
rsk - it doesnt related to fans as they always on
any other moving parts in there apart from fans and drives ?
no - i can also chech what other sound settings will make it like
so recording the sound is the only good idea?
open up the case and use a stethoscope :)
there are many devices to choose from at 'sound'
is the sound coming out of the speakers or out of the system case ?
it is the speakers
try disabling the daemons one at a time, to see which one is causing the "sounds"
what are daemons?
im not sure there is sound in the system by the way
system services. like exim, sysklogd, gpm, gdm etc
extraneous sounds from the speakers can be caused by irq problems and also by rf interference from nearby units
do i need to disable them?
disable each in turn. and put it back on again. when the badness stops, you have the culprit
dunno then. must be the Ghost In The Machine
i will try disabling but how to disable?
